intro: Eriocaulon nautiliformoides var. hexagynum, commonly known as the hexagon leaf spikerush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescences that bear small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in wetland habitats such as marshes and seasonally flooded areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of aquatic and riparian ecosystems.
